columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the fleet.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the fleet.

columns.name: instance_type
columns.description: The instance type to use when launching fleet instances.

columns.name: state
columns.description: The current state for the fleet.

columns.name: created_time
columns.description: The time the fleet was created.

columns.name: description
columns.description: The description to display.

columns.name: display_name
columns.description: The fleet name to display.

columns.name: disconnect_timeout_in_seconds
columns.description: The amount of time that a streaming session remains active after users disconnect. If they try to reconnect to the streaming session after a disconnection or network interruption within this time interval, they are connected to their previous session. Otherwise, they are connected to a new session with a new streaming instance. Specify a value between 60 and 360000.

columns.name: directory_name
columns.description: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

columns.name: organizational_unit_distinguished_name
columns.description: The distinguished name of the organizational unit for computer accounts.

columns.name: enable_default_internet_access
columns.description: Indicates whether default internet access is enabled for the fleet.

columns.name: fleet_type
columns.description: The fleet type. ALWAYS_ON Provides users with instant-on access to their apps. You are charged for all running instances in your fleet, even if no users are streaming apps. ON_DEMAND Provide users with access to applications after they connect, which takes one to two minutes. You are charged for instance streaming when users are connected and a small hourly fee for instances that are not streaming apps.

columns.name: iam_role_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the IAM role that is applied to the fleet.

columns.name: idle_disconnect_timeout_in_seconds
columns.description: The amount of time that users can be idle (inactive) before they are disconnected from their streaming session and the DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds time interval begins.

columns.name: image_arn
columns.description: The ARN for the public, private, or shared image.

columns.name: image_name
columns.description: The name of the image used to create the fleet.

columns.name: max_concurrent_sessions
columns.description: The maximum number of concurrent sessions for the fleet.

columns.name: max_user_duration_in_seconds
columns.description: The maximum amount of time that a streaming session can remain active, in seconds. If users are still connected to a streaming instance five minutes before this limit is reached, they are prompted to save any open documents before being disconnected.

columns.name: platform
columns.description: The platform of the fleet.

columns.name: stream_view
columns.description: The AppStream 2.0 view that is displayed to your users when they stream from the fleet. When APP is specified, only the windows of applications opened by users display. When DESKTOP is specified, the standard desktop that is provided by the operating system displays. The default value is APP.

columns.name: compute_capacity_status
columns.description: The capacity status for the fleet.

columns.name: fleet_errors
columns.description: The fleet errors.

columns.name: session_script_s3_location
columns.description: The S3 location of the session scripts configuration zip file. This only applies to Elastic fleets.

columns.name: usb_device_filter_strings
columns.description: The USB device filter strings associated with the fleet.

columns.name: vpc_config
columns.description: The VPC configuration for the fleet.
